name: ab-av1
description: AV1 re-encoding using ffmpeg, svt-av1 & vmaf

repo.name: ab-av1
repo.description: AV1 re-encoding using ffmpeg, svt-av1 & vmaf.

readme.summary: Clear command reference with good installation steps, but lacks concrete usage examples and configuration details.
readme.top_issue: No working examples with actual values - all examples show only the option syntax without demonstrating real-world usage with sample parameters

injection_risks.description: The `vcodec` and `preset` variables are used to construct command-line arguments for the `ffmpeg` command. If these variables come from an untrusted source, it could lead to a command injection vulnerability.
The `audio_codec` variable is used to construct command-line arguments for the `ffmpeg` command. If this variable comes from an untrusted source, it could lead to a command injection vulnerability.

critical_findings: Potential command injection vulnerability in the `ffmpeg` command construction
Lack of input validation and sanitization for user-provided data
security.summary: The code has some security concerns, including potential command injection vulnerabilities and lack of input validation, but does not appear to have any critical secrets or error exposure issues.

common_complaints: Unclear error messages (crf-search failures need better explanation)
Feature requests for audio filtering and additional metrics (SSIMULACRA2)
Edge cases with VMAF calculations (timebase issues, fps_mode handling)
Documentation gaps (scaling for different resolutions not obvious)
praise_themes: Useful crf-search feature for batch processing
sentiment.summary: Highly engaged community with constructive feature requests and bug reports; maintainer appears responsive with recent issues showing active discussion and recent closures suggesting ongoing development.

communication.summary: The maintainer provides clear, detailed, and helpful responses. They are patient with repeated questions and maintain a welcoming tone.

concerns: No closed issues in past 6 months despite 63 open issues
No merged PRs in past 6 months

Last commit over 10 days ago with no recent activity
High number of unresolved issues (63) suggests lack of maintenance
maintenance.summary: This package appears abandoned with no maintenance activity, issue resolution, or contributor engagement over the past 6 months.

changelog.summary: The changelog is well-categorized and appears comprehensive, but lacks clear marking of breaking changes and migration guides.

project_metrics.description: AV1 re-encoding using ffmpeg, svt-av1 & vmaf.
